statements: SELECT * FROM weather_alerts;
SELECT alert_type, severity, location FROM weather_alerts;
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts WHERE severity='High';
SELECT alert_id, alert_type, location FROM weather_alerts ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_alerts FROM weather_alerts WHERE location='New York';
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts ORDER BY timestamp DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT alert_id, alert_type, location FROM weather_alerts WHERE severity = 'High'
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts WHERE location LIKE 'New%'
SELECT alert_id, alert_type, severity, location, timestamp FROM weather_alerts WHERE severity IN ('High', 'Medium') AND location = 'California' ORDER BY timestamp ASC
SELECT alert_id, alert_type, location FROM weather_alerts WHERE timestamp > '2022-01-01'
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts;
SELECT id, location, alert_type FROM weather_alerts WHERE alert_type = 'Severe';
SELECT location, alert_message FROM weather_alerts WHERE alert_time >= '2022-01-01 00:00:00';
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts ORDER BY alert_time DESC;
SELECT id, location, alert_type, alert_message FROM weather_alerts WHERE location LIKE '%City%';
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts WHERE alert_type = 'Hurricane' ORDER BY alert_time DESC;
SELECT location, alert_type, alert_message FROM weather_alerts WHERE alert_type = 'Tornado' ORDER BY location ASC;
SELECT id, location, alert_type, DATE(alert_time) as alert_date FROM weather_alerts WHERE location = 'New York' AND alert_type = 'Snowstorm' ORDER BY alert_time;
SELECT id, alert_type, alert_message, DATE(alert_time) as alert_date FROM weather_alerts WHERE alert_type = 'Flood' ORDER BY id DESC;
SELECT user_id, notification_type, message, created_at FROM user_notifications WHERE notification_type LIKE '%Warning%' ORDER BY created_at DESC;
SELECT * FROM WeatherAlerts;
SELECT alert_id, alert_type FROM WeatherAlerts WHERE alert_level='High';
SELECT user_name, user_location FROM UserLocations WHERE user_location='New York';
SELECT notification_id, notification_type, notification_message FROM UserNotifications ORDER BY notification_timestamp DESC;
SELECT alert_description, alert_timestamp FROM WeatherAlerts WHERE alert_level='Low' LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM WeatherAlerts WHERE alert_id = 1;
SELECT alert_type, alert_description, alert_timestamp FROM WeatherAlerts ORDER BY alert_timestamp DESC;
SELECT user_name, user_location FROM UserLocations WHERE user_id IN (1, 2, 3) ORDER BY user_name ASC;
SELECT notification_type, notification_message FROM UserNotifications WHERE notification_timestamp >= '2022-01-01' AND notification_timestamp < '2022-02-01';
SELECT UL.user_name, WN.notification_type FROM UserLocations UL JOIN UserNotifications WN ON UL.user_id = WN.user_id WHERE WN.notification_type = 'Weather Alert';
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts;
SELECT alert_id, alert_type, alert_message FROM weather_alerts ORDER BY alert_time DESC;
SELECT AVG(alert_time) AS average_time FROM weather_alerts;
SELECT user_id, username, email FROM users WHERE username = 'john_doe';
SELECT * FROM user_notifications WHERE notification_time > '2022-01-01' ORDER BY notification_time;
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts;
SELECT alert_type, alert_message FROM weather_alerts WHERE alert_time > '2022-10-01';
SELECT u.username, w.alert_type, n.notification_time FROM users u JOIN user_notifications n ON u.user_id = n.user_id JOIN weather_alerts w ON n.alert_id = w.alert_id;
SELECT w.alert_type, COUNT(n.notification_id) AS notifications_count FROM weather_alerts w LEFT JOIN user_notifications n ON w.alert_id = n.alert_id GROUP BY w.alert_type;

SELECT u.username, w.alert_message, ah.history_time FROM users u INNER JOIN user_notifications n ON u.user_id = n.user_id INNER JOIN alerts_history ah ON n.notification_id = ah.notification_id INNER JOIN weather_alerts w ON ah.alert_id = w.alert_id WHERE u.username = 'john_doe';
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts;
SELECT a_type, a_location, a_description FROM weather_alerts WHERE a_severity = 'High';
SELECT u_name, u_email FROM users WHERE u_location = 'New York';
SELECT * FROM user_notifications WHERE n_timestamp >= '2022-01-01' ORDER BY n_timestamp DESC;
SELECT c_name, c_description FROM alert_categories WHERE c_name LIKE '%weather%';
SELECT * FROM weather_alerts WHERE a_severity = 'High';
SELECT a_type, a_location, a_timestamp FROM weather_alerts WHERE a_location LIKE '%New York%' ORDER BY a_timestamp DESC;
SELECT u_name, u_email, u_location FROM users WHERE u_location = 'California' AND u_phone_number IS NOT NULL;

SELECT u_name, u_email, COUNT(n_id) AS notification_count FROM users JOIN user_notifications ON u_id = n_user_id GROUP BY u_name, u_email HAVING notification_count > 5 ORDER BY notification_count DESC;
SELECT c_name, COUNT(s_id) AS subscriber_count FROM alert_subscribers JOIN alert_categories ON c_id = s_category_id GROUP BY c_name HAVING subscriber_count > 0 ORDER BY subscriber_count DESC;
